metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000161 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
nmap version 6.49BETA6 through 7.60, up to and including SVN revision 37147contains a Directory Traversal vulnerability in NSE script http-fetch thatcan result in file overwrite as the user is running it. This attack appearsto be exploitable via a victim that runs NSE script http-fetch against amalicious web site. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 7.7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000161` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ncat - 7.91+dfsg1+really7.80+dfsg1-2build1
ndiff - 7.91+dfsg1+really7.80+dfsg1-2build1
nmap - 7.91+dfsg1+really7.80+dfsg1-2build1
nmap-common - 7.91+dfsg1+really7.80+dfsg1-2build1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nmap package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.91+dfsg1+really7.80+dfsg1-2build1').
